meanings.definition: To conceive again; to form a new conception of.
meanings.sent1: After learning more about space, she had to reconceive how planets are formed.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reconceive her painting by adding more colors and shapes.
meanings.sent3: Trying to bake a cake without flour made her reconceive her baking skills.
meanings.sent4: His failure at the game forced him to reconceive his strategy for winning.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle was so challenging that she had to reconceive her approach to solving it.

meanings.definition: To think of in a new way; to reconsider.
meanings.sent1: He had to reconceive his plan after realizing it was too risky.
meanings.sent2: She asked him to reconceive his opinion on the matter after hearing all the facts.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to eat the new food made her reconceive her choice of cat treats.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected results made him reconceive his hypothesis about the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The feedback from the audience made her reconceive her approach to the presentation.
